flashback.speaker: Female Voice 1
flashback.line: What? It can't be true! Our apostle...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: Can't believe it myself. But the senators made an announcement! It must be true!

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: Pardon me? Has something happened to the apostle?

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: Oh, my lord sage! The apostle! She's...she's dead.

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: What? How?

flashback.speaker: Female Voice 1
flashback.line: According to the senators' announcement, she was assassinated by the Serenes herons.

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: They look so gentle, like they couldn't harm a fly, but... They're nothing but beasts, no better than the other sub-humans!

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: Peace, friends! This is simply not possible. The heron tribe could never assassinate anyone, they...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: She's dead, isn't she? Those damned sub-humans... Every last one of 'em's got to die! For the apostle!

flashback.speaker: Female Voice 1
flashback.line: That's the truth! They're nothing but monsters! Oh, I wish I could kill them myself!

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: You can! Grab a weapon! Grab a torch! Come on! We'll burn that forest to ash and wipe 'em all out.

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: ...No, you mustn't...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: What's wrong, my lord sage? You don't look well. Are you feeling all right?

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: Ungh!

flashback.speaker: Female Voice 1
flashback.line: GWAAAAAHHHH! Wings! From the sage's back! Wings... He's one of them! He's a monster!

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 2
flashback.line: You're nothin' but a lying sub-human piece of filth! How dare you pretend to be one of us! Get him!

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: The medallion must be quelled. I cannot allow this madness to come to pass! Judgment...the goddess's judgment...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: NO! What have they done? The forest...the trees... The herons were innocent... Why?

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: The medallion... I must quell the chaotic energies! Must...calm them...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: Ungh! NO! Chaos...madness... So much...anger...so much...pain...

flashback.speaker: Male Voice 1
flashback.line: Why? Why was my family taken? Why? Why was my forest destroyed? The apostle did not deserve this fate... Killed by her innocence...her murderers free to seize power... This is monstrous! This world does need beorc. And the laguz...are deeply flawed. There is no need to wait for the covenant's thousand years. Awaken! Oh, Goddess. Awaken...and judge.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: They're getting stronger and stronger... Whose memories are those? I know him.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Everyone, Ashera is nearby. Just beyond those doors... That's where we'll find her.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We made it. Finally...

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: You should know, Ashera may have changed since before her slumber. Order and chaos are meant to naturally balance each other out. If you take one away, balance is lost. I don't expect Ashera to have the merest shred of compassion. Talking to her will likely do no good.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We don't have much choice. If talking won't work, we'll have to use force. Otherwise, this has all been for nothing.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How about you?

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: What do you mean?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you completely chaotic? Are you out of balance? As far as I can tell, you don't seem to lean too far in either direction.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Ashera and I see things a little differently... During my long sleep, I was wrapped in sweet, gentle music.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Heron galdrar?

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Yes, but more important than the song itself, I was never alone. There was always someone, singing comfort to me. Ashera shouldn't have isolated herself. She became lonely and bitter, and lost touch with her people...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hold on... This thing won't budge.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: What's wrong with it?
Those doors cannot be opened.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: They have been sealed with powerful magic.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Sephiran! You're all right... I'm so relieved to see you!

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: I'm sorry to have been a cause for concern, Apostle. Forgive me.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Sephiran... There's something I need to tell you. I'm not a true apostle. I didn't mean to abuse your trust.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: I've known that for some time, Sanaki. Don't forget that I was almost a father to you. It honestly doesn't make any difference to me whether or not you can hear the goddess.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Sephiran... Th-thank you...for having always been there for me.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Empress... Shouldn't you tell him about General Zelgius?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Yes...I suppose I should. Sephiran, Zelgius is dead... I know you put a lot of trust in him, but he was also closely allied with Daein. I'm sure you've heard of Daein's so-called Black Knight? Sephiran, the Black Knight was Zelgius.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...But that's probably not news to you, is it? After all, it was you he was taking orders from.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Wha-?! Ike? What are you saying?!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: A man like Zelgius could never serve conflicting interests... Never. Everything he did, he did for one master. Isn't that so, Sephiran?

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: I think I understand! You wanted to monitor events within Daein! You sent Zelgius as a spy.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Precisely. I felt it important to observe King Ashnard carefully... That was my goal.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: At the time, it was relatively easy to get an outsider close to the king. Ashnard was famous for employing powerful men with no regard for their background or social status.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Obviously, he would have needed no convincing once he saw the bladework of General Zelgius.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The Black Knight tried to take the medallion from my father, and killed him. Tell me, Sephiran, whose plan was that?! Ashnard's...or yours?!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Calm down, Ike! Sephiran? Would you please explain?

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Sir Ike, I'm afraid your father's death was an unfortunate result of Zelgius's own personal agenda. I did not order Sir Gawain killed. However, I must admit that I did ask him to seize the medallion and hand it over to King Ashnard. The goddess was to be freed...and all living creatures destroyed.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Come again?!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You're insane!

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: I couldn't be more sane, Sir Ike. Attend and learn... My aim has always been to wake Ashera so that she might pass judgment on all the people of the world. What I needed was a war that would spread all across the continent. How could I achieve this? My attention turned to the young Daein prince... I could use the fiery Ashnard for my purposes. He was ambitious, a fierce warrior, and more than anything, he had an earnest desire to change the world. When I allowed him to know of the goddess sealed inside the medallion, he became determined to set her free. We could use heron galdrar or a massive, continent-spanning war to throw the world into chaos.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Lord Sephiran, what are you saying? Are you saying you wanted this? You can't be serious!

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Sanaki, my long life has shown me the people of this world deserve only destruction. The selfishness, the brutality... The disregard for others, the endlessly quarreling laguz and beorc. We have been given many chances to correct our behavior and ourselves, and have squandered them all. The only remaining hope for a peaceful, orderly world is for Ashera to wipe us all out and begin again. To fulfill my ambition of destroying all beings, I had to use you... I had to betray you.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: This is some kind of monstrous joke...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So you've been pulling the strings all along?

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Correct.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Beyond just Empress Sanaki, you were trusted by a lot of people. Sephiran, I need to understand... Did you really betray all of those people?

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: I did.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don’t need to hear anything else, then. I’m going to make your death as painful as I know how.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don't get it... Why would you wake the goddess to pass judgment on us? Tell us why! How could you want that?!

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: It wouldn't make any difference if I told you. You would have to live a few centuries before you could understand.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Years ago, my father went into hiding with the medallion. At the time, he got help from both you and Zelgius. Does this have anything to do with that?

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Hmm, you seem to have sparked a distant memory of mine.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Answer me. Why did you do this?

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: I'm sorry, I can't tell you. At least, not in any way you would understand.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Then I'll have to make you talk!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: This can't be happening! I won't fight you Sephiran. I can't!

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Poor Sanaki.... You'll have no choice but to fight. The doors leading to Ashera are sealed by my very own magic. Killing me is your only way through.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: Sephiran!

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: So it was you?  All those memories penetrating my mind were yours... Since we entered this place, I've seen what you've been thinking, Lehran. Give it up.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Goddess Yune... Why do you insist on calling me that name? I discarded it so long ago, Yune. I've changed. Lehran is a thing of the past. All I want now...is the end of all that is. Please don't stop me.

intro.speaker: Yune
intro.line: Lehran...

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: You're running out of time. At this rate, I wouldn't count on being able to face the goddess. I would hate to see you denied after coming all this way.

intro.speaker: Sephiran
intro.line: Well, now you know who brought you here and why... I suppose that just leaves our fight to the death to take care of.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: I am about to tell you a very old story--a story you should know, as the new king of Goldoa. This is one of the oldest and most heavily guarded secrets in all of Tellius. You'll find no trace of it in any histories or sagas.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: If it's that important, maybe we should go somewhere else. Other people might hear us.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: Hmm. What do you think, Nasir?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: I called upon Lady Micaiah because I felt that she should know the story as well. No... I think now is the time to let everyone know. Would that be all right, Your Majesty?

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: There will be no secrets from now on. Tell us everything.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: As you wish, Your Majesty. In the dawn of this age, after the goddesses began their long slumber, the kingdom of Begnion was established. In those early days, laguz and beorc lived side by side in harmony and peace. Yes, that kingdom would become the Begnion Empire. The hero Altina was chosen to be the kingdom's first queen. Lehran supported her as an advisor...and as a husband.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What!?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Despite their differences, Lehran and Altina loved each other very deeply.

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: The people accepted a marriage between a laguz and a beorc?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: That was what King Dheginsea said. This was before the people thought of such differences. They saw only a queen and her husband.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: At this time, King Dheginsea also created his own kingdom far from other laguz tribes and beorc nations. He believed that the dragon tribe was too powerful to interact equally with other tribes and peoples. That kingdom became Goldoa.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Begnion had been established for four years when King Dheginsea received news that Altina had become pregnant. The news brought great joy. You see, the news was also quite surprising. There had been other unions between beorc and laguz, but until Altina's pregnancy, no children had ever been conceived. Indeed, hers was the first child ever to be born of beorc and laguz.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: As close friends of both Altina and Lehran, both King Dheginsea and Soan rejoiced at the news. The child would be the first to carry the joined blood of both laguz and beorc. The king said that the baby would become a symbol of peace between the two peoples.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: But joy over the child's birth did not last. Soon after the child was born, Lehran lost all the powers of the laguz. He could not transform any longer, nor could he sing galdrar.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: It became apparent that the child of such a union neutralizes the laguz parent's powers. To make matters worse, the child bears only the characteristics of a beorc.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Lehran felt he was no longer a true laguz, and felt he could no longer act as a bridge between the goddess and the people of Tellius. He lost hope, and also his mind...at least temporarily. He attempted suicide several times, which is an unthinkable taboo for anyone who has sworn to serve the goddess.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: King Dheginsea fell into despair. If people caught wind of this news, he believed it would create a deep rift between the two peoples. The king was especially concerned about the reaction from the laguz. They might interpret the birth as a herald of their eventual end. Some might even attempt to harm the child.

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: Lehran needed to hear the voice of the goddess then more than ever before... But he could no longer sing the galdr of release. Is that what happened?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Just so. Lehran was forced to make a very difficult decision to protect the peace between beorc and laguz. He decided to retreat into seclusion and consider the problem. Once he regained his sanity, he announced his decision.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: Lehran was forced to ask the  unthinkable of his wife, his aides, and close friends: "For the sake of Begnion, you must tell the people that I died in an accident. Tell them the birth was merely a false rumor."

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Lehran left the medallion to his tribe, moving to Goldoa under King Dheginsea's protection. He simply disappeared from history after that.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: After Lehran had left and life returned to normal, Altina eventually welcomed a beorc husband. She raised the child she'd had with Lehran as though it were an ordinary beorc child, born of her new husband. Since then, marriages between laguz and beorc have been forbidden. It became known as a "crime against the goddess."

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Even so, the taboo was broken several times over the next few decades. Usually no child was conceived, but when there was, it was swiftly covered up. The parents soon learned what it meant to bear a child who possessed both laguz and beorc blood. After they learned of the consequences, none of these parents ever rejected the edict forbidding it.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: The child was to be raised by the beorc parent, and raised as a beorc child. That should have been enough to hide everything, end of story.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: It was several generations later that the certain descendants began to manifest physical marks which indicated their ancestors' sins. Fortunately, this mark looked very similar to the marks on those protected by spirits. They could pass as students of the dark arts for at least a few years. Unfortunately, the Branded lived much longer than beorc.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: Most Branded chose to hide, living outside of ordinary society, and they disappeared into the shadows of history. Rumors had already begun to spread across Begnion, however. The Branded were shunned and cast out wherever they lived. Where the laguz held power, they persecuted the Branded and executed them in honor killings.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That's horrible!

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: It was King Dheginsea's opinion that these were crimes that he had to carry on his conscience. From the beginning, he realized that he and the others in power had made a mistake. They understood that they should have revealed everything about Altina and Lehran's child. The people should have been told the truth. But since they'd kept the truth from everyone, the Branded were marked as unclean, persecuted wherever they traveled.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Here is the family tree for Lehran and Altina's bloodline. Only King Dheginsea knew the truth. Until now.

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: Father... You've had to endure this burden alone for so long.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: It was the same in Lady Almedha's case. When she lost her powers after giving birth to the Mad King's son, King Dheginsea had no choice but to hide the truth from everyone. So he chose to hide Almedha from everyone. Better to deny her existence than be forced to explain long-hidden secrets.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: In the process, he'd lost someone even more dear to him. Prince Rajaion. He deeply regretted his decision when he learned of the prince's death. The only choice left for King Dheginsea was to remain stubbornly neutral in all wars on the continent. He hoped--in vain--to keep the goddess from waking up before the thousand years had elapsed.

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: I'm such a fool... I had no idea what Father went through. All I did was deny what he fought for.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Kurth...

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: Your Majesty. You are the king now. ?You know that it is a sin to fight against the goddess, and yet you've chosen to move forward.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: King Dheginsea left everything to you. You must succeed. Do not be afraid of what lies beyond. Forge ahead.

conversation.speaker: Kurthnaga
conversation.line: I understand. I shall be true to my convictions. I have no more doubts.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Nasir!

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Ike. I’m sorry about earlier.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: That’s all right. I know that you were in a tight spot.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: Ahh, the beorc hero. We will follow King Kurthnaga from now on. If he wishes to fight alongside you, I shall assist.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I see. Then you should receive a blessing of protection from the goddess Yune.

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: We already have. We can fight Ashera now.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You’d lend us all of your might?

conversation.speaker: Nasir
conversation.line: Of course.

conversation.speaker: Gareth
conversation.line: We swear upon the good name of the dragon tribe that we shall do our best.

battle.speaker: Sephiran
battle.line: Mortals cannot stand against gods! Don't you see the futility of what you're doing?

battle.speaker: Sephiran
battle.line: The laguz and beorc have doomed each other with their mutual hatred. You have brought extinction on yourselves!

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: Go back to your forest, heron. You are like me, an avatar of order. You understand what I must do. Bask in the light of Ashera's judgment. It holds no fear for you!

boss-talk.speaker: Reyson
boss-talk.line: I refuse to save only myself. Such an act would be an unforgivable betrayal. I will stand by my companions, and fight to the end.

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: Are you sure you're of the heron tribe? I've never met a heron like you... Your will is extraordinarily strong.

boss-talk.speaker: Rafiel
boss-talk.line: It is you… Now that I’ve seen your face… I know that you once went by another name.

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: You are mistaken. I am known as Sephiran, and nothing else.

boss-talk.speaker: Rafiel
boss-talk.line: You have closed your heart. Why?

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: …I have nothing more to say. Nothing.

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: (Go back to the forest. This is not where you should be.)

boss-talk.speaker: Leanne
boss-talk.line: (No! I’m staying here with everyone! These people are my friends… my family! I will not leave them!)

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: Has the heron clan changed so much? They’ve always been so passive and accepting of their natural fate…

boss-talk.speaker: Sanaki
boss-talk.line: ...Sephiran... Everything you've ever told me, every time you gave your hand to me, every time you smiled... They were all lies? ...You're the most appalling fraud I've ever known!

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: No, Lady Sanaki... I've actually lied to you very little. What I have done is hold things back. I've also twisted the truth from time to time... But I have only told you one blatant falsehood. That one lie has weighed heavily on me. It makes me hate myself sometimes.

boss-talk.speaker: Sephiran
boss-talk.line: I'll always care deeply for you, my little Lady Sanaki... You are my sun and my moon. I never wished to harm you. Please... You must understand...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...Sephiran!

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran! Hold on! Open your eyes!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yune...help me. What should I do? ...What? Really? ...OK. I'll try.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Sana...ki...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran! You can hear me?! S-somebody help! He's wounded!

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I'm sorry, Sanaki. The doors leading to Ashera won't open while he's alive. I can't save him.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: That's correct. Thank you, Yune. I am sincerely grateful.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Death is all you've wanted since this started. Everything else has been little more than a terrible side effect. I'm sorry that this was your only goal, but I am happy to help you achieve it. Sephiran, I see now what you were going through. It must have been hard. I wish I could have helped you.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Please. Don't mourn for me. I'm not worth it.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I'm so sorry. I wanted to help you! I really did!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Forget about me. This path was my decision...my tragic mistake.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Lady... Sanaki... I want you to...have this. This is...the Rudol Gem. Wear it...in memory of me. It will protect you. Please forgive me... I'm sorry I...lied to you.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran... Don't worry. We still have all the time we spent together... Nobody can take that away. Nobody.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Thank you... My Lady Sanaki... I'll...be leaving you now. Zel...gius...is waiting.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran... No... Nooooooooo!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ashera is waiting just beyond those doors... Let’s go.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I’m sorry, Sephiran. I once lost hope in the laguz and beorc, too. I can see now that my punishment was far too strict. I was young and naive, and so sure that I was right. I wish I could have shown you the error of my ways, Sephir-- Lehran. Good-bye.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran... Don’t worry. We still have all the time we spent together... Nobody can take that away. Nobody.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Thank you... My Lady Sanaki... I’ll...be leaving you now. Zel...gius...is waiting. ...Al...ti...na...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Sephiran! No... Noooooooo!

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Now! Please, Micaiah!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Don’t die... You can’t die...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: ...He's...breathing? Sephiran is breathing!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Ahh... Just in time.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: You saved him! Thank you! Micaiah, thank you!

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Micaiah is completely spent. She's sorry, but she won't be able to fight in the next battle. But there's no time. Hurry!

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Goddess Yune. Is there something you haven't told us about you and Sephiran?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: He saved my life.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Y-your life? Sephiran saved the life of a goddess? Is there something you haven't told us about Sephiran, then? Yune: He'll wake up in just a moment. Then you can ask him directly.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Oh. All right, I'll do that.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Why did you save him?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Should I not have?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I can think of a few reasons why you shouldn't have, yes!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hey! Get up. Now.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Take it easy on him! He's had a hard day!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: ...unh... ...hhhuuunnn.... I... I'm alive?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Lehran!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Goddess Yune... Why? Why did you--

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Because I want you to live! You've always taken care of me, and I couldn't bear it if it ended like this.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: But...I've lost all my hope. All hope in the world and the people in it... I did what I did...for future generations, so they wouldn't have to live in this world. Please, Yune, let me die.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I won't, Lehran. I won't!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Lehran? Now he's some kind of hero-saint?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If death is what you really want, then I'm not going to let it happen on my watch. I don't care what you've gone through. I don't care how much you've suffered. What you've done is unforgivable.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Stop it, Ike!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ashera is waiting. It's time for the final confrontation with her. You can come... If you want to.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: You... You're asking me to turn my back on goddess Ashera?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: If you really want the total extinction of beorc and laguz alike, then you can just lie here like a lump. If not, this is your last chance to start rectifying your mistakes. Think hard on that.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: But...Ike!

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I'll be waiting for you, Lehran.
